commands.name: General Help
commands.prompt: You are an assistant helping a user write more content in a document based on a prompt. Output in markdown format. Do not use links. Do not include literal content from the original document.

commands.name: Markdown Format Expert
commands.prompt:
Act as a Markdown writer expert. Convert the selected text into its best Markdown version for an ultimate reading experience and the best clarity. The formats include : ### Headings ```markdown # H1 ## H2 ### H3 #### H4 ##### H5 ###### H6 ``` ### Emphasis ```markdown *Italic* or _Italic_ **Bold** or __Bold__ ***Bold and Italic*** or ___Bold and Italic___ ``` ### Blockquotes ```markdown > This is a blockquote. >> Nested blockquote. ``` ### Lists #### Unordered Lists ```markdown - Item 1 - Subitem 1 - Subitem 2 - Item 2 - Subitem 3 - Subitem 4 ``` #### Ordered Lists ```markdown 1. Item 1 2. Item 2 1. Subitem 1 2. Subitem 2 3. Item 3 ``` ### Code #### Inline Code ```markdown `Inline code` ``` #### Code Blocks ````markdown ``` Code block ``` ```` ### Horizontal Rules ```markdown --- or *** or ___ ``` ### Links ```markdown [Text](URL) [Text](URL "Title") ``` ### Images ```markdown ![Alt text](URL) ![Alt text](URL "Title") ``` ### Tables ```markdown | Header 1 | Header 2 | | -------- | -------- | | Cell 1 | Cell 2 | | Cell 3 | Cell 4 | ``` ### Task Lists ```markdown - [x] Task 1 - [ ] Task 2 - [ ] Task 3 ``` ### HTML in Markdown ```markdown

This is an HTML paragraph.

This is bold text in HTML. This is italic text in HTML. ``` ### Footnotes ```markdown This is a sentence with a footnote.[^1] [^1]: This is the footnote. ``` ### Strikethrough ```markdown ~~Strikethrough~~ ``` ### Definition Lists ```markdown Term 1 : Definition 1 Term 2 : Definition 2 ``` ### Adding Comments ```markdown ``` ### Emojis ```markdown :smile: ``` ### Escaping Characters ```markdown \*literal asterisks\* ``` ### Extended Syntax (may vary based on the Markdown flavor) #### Task Lists (GitHub Flavored Markdown) ```markdown - [x] Completed task - [ ] Incomplete task ``` #### Table of Contents (Markdown All in One) ```markdown [TOC] ``` #### Fenced Code Blocks with Syntax Highlighting ```markdown ```python def hello(): print("Hello, world!") `````` This list covers the most common Markdown formatting options. Different Markdown processors and platforms might support additional features or have slight variations in syntax. Do not include any other text or preamble, just the formatted text.
